Something that had bothered me a lot was the bad explanation of the past, I still wonder if it was a good idea to have left it for part 2 Anyway, this drama and portrayal of the war gave me a good feeling I don't know why, this ending was until good The descent of our protagonists correspond to our wills which makes it in my view good, for sharing ideals The anime is good to pass the time and I don't know if there willbe a sequel, but if it does, I recommend seeing it for sure.
And all this impacts on the final grade, this time it was to: 8/10
I even come to pronounce that prioritizing English over my native language is unfortunate, but I do not want my opinion deleted, thank you all for reading

PT-BR: Recentemente descobri a parte 2 desse anime e sinceramente adimito que foi melhor qua a parte um.
Algo que tinha me incomodado bastante era a má explicação do passado, ainda me pergunto se foi uma boa ideia ter deixado para a parte 2
enfim, esse drama e retratação da guerra me trouxe um sensação boa não sei porque, esse final foi até que bom
A tomada de descisão dos nossos protagonistas correspondem as nossa vontades o que torna na minha visão bom, por compartilhar ideais
o anime é bom para passar o tempo e não sei se haverá continuação, mas se tiver, recomendo ver com certeza.
e tudo isso impacta na nota final, dessa vez foi para: 8/10
Venho até me pronunciar que priorizar o ingles ao inves da minha lingua natal é lamentavel, porem nao quero te minha opinião excluida, obrigado a todos por ler

I'll judge the first 2 seasons on this review). What can I say about 86? It's a must-see! Let's talk about the obvious. 86 is sublime in its animation. Whether it's the fight scenes, the landscapes, the quieter moments, the details, the characters, the cities, the robots, ... Everything is well done, there are no mistakes, everything is successful. The work is sublime. The scene that most illustrates this beauty is clearly the one in the rose field. Now that we've talked image, let's talk story. It's very well told. Right from the start, we see the social class system present in society between the "grayhairs" and the others. We understand Milizé's ambitions in relation to the latter. The author makes this very interesting, as Milizé's desire to create friendship is not directly accepted by his troops. They're not dumb characters who don't distrust nice people. What's more, despite the relationship that gradually develops. Certain tragic events remind the heroes of the story that this friendship is only very fragile. 
It will obviously grow stronger with each battle and discussion. The Handler gradually manages to shake the Reaper out of his natural coldness and seriousness. If you want to talk a little about season 2, take a look at the adventure surrounding Frederica Rosenfort. Some may find her useless and unbearable at first, but the ending will make you forget all that very quickly.

"Bleach" was unlucky to come out when there are many alternative Shounen that are all like two identical drops of water. There are a lot of interesting characters in Bleach, funny dramatic ones, the characters die there, it's still frankly a teenage title, but he has iron balls in terms of acting dramaturgy... but this is mainstream, now all shounen will look like this. I read manga as a teenager and I'm glad the anime came out, but I'm honest with you there's nothing special about it. the art style is good, but not more, the animation is acceptable, but I know what can be better the music isgood, but I wouldn't listen to it separately on repeat

this title has one big plus there are few fillers and a lot of action

well, there's probably an interesting lore of the entire franchise, but I spread my hands and can't advise, it's exclusively for fans

well, this is a very straightforward quotation of manga, personally I think that a good anime adaptation of manga should be a good ANIME... in manga, there is a special genre where the characters pronounce their actions so that the reader can understand what is happening, in a good anime adaptation this should not be, anime works a little differently, there are pictures moving and you need to show and not tell. the adaptation should complement the manga and not quote it

in fact, I'm lying, the fact is that in manga fights are vague garbage and anime looks more interesting, this is not an achievement of adaptation, but rather a bad manga... yes, I understand that I'm climbing into a bottle, but this is such a genre here just a good Shounen is not enough

Rating: 6 This would have done just as good if it was a live-action anime since they drop all what makes, anime - anime. If you read the manga and watched the anime, this is a completely different story. Where the anime and manga are able to present to us all characters equally, the movie lacks and presents most characters in a hollow way. Music is fine but many times it was awkardly silent to make the anime seem like a real basketball game. They are playing a championship, yet there is a lack of background sound/music plus there is ZERO cheering which makes it seemlike an empty crowd when in fact it is full. 
They make it fast paced and realistic only to ruin it with plenty of flashbacks and occassional slow-motion. If they decided on using slow-motion they could've used it several other times to create tension in the game (as they did on the anime and manga). Since they use plenty of flashbacks, it ruins the pace and tension of the game. 
The rivals and the rivalry seem empty and the Shohoku (the protagonist team) seems empty too. 

All that aised, it is good if you want to learn a bit more about Miyagi Ryouta in the whole series. I would say this movie would have done better if it focused on Ryouta the whole movie rather than compromising and failing at all. OR they could've introduce all his background at the beginning and shown the game afterwards (including more sound too). The story is nice, but if you are trying to look for Slam Dunk, this is not it. 

 I love Slam Dunk for it's cheering atmostphere no matter how grim it might seem. All the character's interaction in the team seem so wholesome and funny (in the anime and manga). Ryouta blushes everytime when Ayako talks to him and smiles. The movie took this off and made them too serious even the way (former main character with red hair) Sakuragi interacts seems off putting. 
I do apreciate the bold new approach, but this could've done better in several areas. A 40min OVA could've done better. 
I will watch it again to focus on Miyagi Ryouta but my main complaints still stand. 
-lack of sound/music
-hollow characters
-awkard interactions

The CGI Resident Evil films in my opinion were always WAY more miss than hit and the only people that liked them or at least were willing to look past their massive issues due to their love for the characters were huge fans of the Resident Evil IP . Up until now I can't say that I've liked any of these original stories all that much beyond the novelty of "Oh look there's Rebecca , Sure haven't seen her in a while!" but Death Island was a surprisingly enjoyable pop corn flick Now don't get me wrong the bar wasn't set very high with Vendettaand especially Infinite Darkness but I found the action to be well choreographed and the animation to be pretty good overall . They tried to do some interesting things here with Jill's PTSD of sorts after the events of Resident Evil 5 and the main villain actually calling out how hypocritical and ineffectual the main cast of this series has been but nothing gets enough time in the oven and overall both plot points disappoint 

Nobody will or should see this film expecting masterful writing or complex character motivations . This is nothing but a fanservice movie where damn near all the fan favorites come together (I do miss old Jill though but new one is fine) to defeat yet another bio-terror threat and that's all there is to it

Recommend it to Resident Evil fans and nobody else

The Anime is basically how Women think. The problems and inter personal relationship they face are not complicated or serious, yet they portray it as veeeery complicated, they show as if there is a problem in stupid and casual scenarios. I definitely do not recommend this anime to anyone. 10 billion percent bullshit. Please watch some psychological thriller or something else instead of wasting your time in this bullshit. This anime will be definitely sympathised by most women because stuff they talk about are definitely the kind of topic my mother shouts about all day to my father. The art style and character designs are fabulous andgorgeous and the reason I started watching this anime. It is definitely a huuge waste to have such good art and animation to this piece of garbage. The budget and work should've been invested in anime's like Wotakoi or Grand Blue😞😞. 

Overall this anime is definitely does not have any proper suspense or mystery or any likable factor. I'm suuuper surprised that this garbage is rated 8+. I'd personally like to have a word with every person who rated this anime more than 4. A complete waste of time.

entry.title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Comedy wa Machigatteiru. Zoku

data.review:
I honestly do not like the song at all, there's something about the percussion that gives me a headache and everything feels choppy, compressed, and over-mixed. However, the music video itself is wonderful, it reminds me of old children's books. It's a shame that such a pretty video is attached to this song. I'd recommend watching the video with the song muted, but if that ruins the experience for you then I'd say don't watch it at all. uhhhh ok so the site wants me to add more stuff, uhhh "Do you think the art style is fitting for the story?" No, it's not, again Ithink the art is too good for this video. "Were the characters well-rounded?" Well they were certainly playful and imaginative, I think those are good characteristics. "Did the characters react to situations and events in a realistic way?" As best they could, yeah.

Is that good enough? I think that's good enough.
